intro: Lissochilus affinis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or alpine environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
